Description: Fragment of a bead of square section: from a bead of dark-green glass. The usual impressed undulating serpent is in opaque turquoise-blue, pale red, white, black, yellow and light green. There are no borders. Matt surface. Possibly from camel-trappings.
Curator's comments: The pale red found in this example and on others is not known in ancient glass. It is suggestive of Islamic work and may be a clue to the date of this work. Little more than one face is preserved. Cf. .6281 and 1891,0509.38.
